channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Goldman Sachs has warned its staff about sneaking off to Paris during the Olympics—and leaving the bank to pick up the tab
item.description: “In line with previous Olympic games, we have asked our people to effectively manage their spend and ensure coordination."

item.title: Glass Lewis endorses 6 of activist Ancora's nominees for Norfolk Southern board
item.description: Norfolk Southern shareholders should vote for activist Ancora's nominees, proxy advisor firm Glass Lewis recommended, a strong sign of support ahead of a May 9 meeting.

item.title: Ryanair's Michael O'Leary, who is up for a $108 million bonus, doesn’t see high CEO pay as a problem: 'Footballers are getting half a million a week'
item.description: Michael O'Leary says that if football players and their managers can get paid in the multi-millions, why not him?

item.title: Monday's analyst calls: Apple gets a big upgrade, headwinds seen for Lululemon and Tesla
item.description: Monday's analyst calls included an upgrade to Apple and a move in the opposite direction for athleisure giant Lulu Lemon and electric car marker Tesla.

item.title: EU's unwinnable EV price war: BYD cars 11 times more profitable in Europe than in China
item.description: Only a highly unlikely 50% import tariff would be enough to deter Chinese automakers from Europe, new research finds.

item.title: Pedro Sanchez stays on as Spain's prime minister after weighing exit
item.description: Spain's Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said on Monday he had decided to continue in office, days after abruptly announcing he was considering his future.

item.title: McKinsey boss tries to boost staff morale amid layoffs by blasting Eminem, Bob Marley and Chumbawamba
item.description: Global Managing Partner Bob Sternfels told his fellow partners at the mid-April event that McKinsey is expecting a good 2024 after its challenges of the past 18 months.

item.title: Tesla jumps 8% in premarket trade after passing key hurdle to roll out full self-driving in China
item.description: Shares of Tesla rose sharply in U.S. premarket trading after the company passed a significant milestone to roll out its full self-driving technology in China.

item.title: Why Sam Bankman-Fried is turning against A-list FTX boosters—and what could happen to them
item.description: Some of the celebs who took money to tout SBF’s exchange may be in hotter water than others.

item.title: Philips shares rocket 46% as firm settles U.S. respiratory device case
item.description: Philips shares soared Monday after the company agreed a $1.1 billion settlement in a U.S. case linked to the recall of some of its sleep apnea devices.
